echo $body | mail \

-a "MIME-Version: 1.0" \
-a "Content-Type: text/html" \
-s "This is the subject" \
you@example.com

 as a subject; be careful to quote subjects containing spaces).

au_355823: file=/path/to/file
mailalert(){
sendmail -F Sender-Name -it <<END_MESSAGE
To: Recipient@example.com
Subject: Subject

$(cat $file)
END_MESSAGE
}

Explanations about Options.-t:
Read message, searching for recipients. ``To:'', `Cc:'', and ``Bcc:'' lines will
 be scanned for people to send to. Any addresses in the argument list will be
 suppressed (not supported).
